intro: Pycnophyllum macrophyllum, commonly known as the giant flame tree, is a striking tropical plant characterized by its large, showy red flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in warm, humid climates. The plant has a woody stem with a smooth, grayish-brown bark that becomes fissured with age. Its flowers are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences, adding a dramatic visual impact to the landscape. The leaves are typically 15–30 cm in length and have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
